page.title: 03ELMBRIDGE - HOME EQUIPMENT
page.content: Perhaps the most noticeable fact about home life in this area is that every single household has at least one television set,one has four,which would imply that viewing is an individual occupation rather than one for the whole family. All homes have electricity,but a few still rely on privatewater supplies which restricts the use of automatic washing machines,and they have to have a septic tank for sewage. ONly three homes have no telephone,these same households do not have a car or a freezer,they are all senior citizens who have lived in the same cottages for many years. Apart from these three most of the families have well equiped homes,including tumble driers, micro-wave ovens, vidoes and one has a computer.
